intro: Conyza magellanica, commonly known as the Magellanic fleabane, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Conyza magellanica is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
